detaileddescription.para:
Process a new point from LV_INDEV_TYPE_POINTER input device
i
pointer to an input device
data
pointer to the data read from the input device

Process a new point from LV_INDEV_TYPE_KEYPAD input device
i
pointer to an input device
data
pointer to the data read from the input device

Process a new point from LV_INDEV_TYPE_ENCODER input device
i
pointer to an input device
data
pointer to the data read from the input device

Process new points from a input device. indev->state.pressed has to be set
indev
pointer to an input device state
x
x coordinate of the next point
y
y coordinate of the next point

Process the pressed state of LV_INDEV_TYPE_POINER input devices
indev
pointer to an input device 'proc'
LV_RES_OK: no indev reset required; LV_RES_INV: indev reset is required

Process the released state of LV_INDEV_TYPE_POINER input devices
proc
pointer to an input device 'proc'

Process a new point from LV_INDEV_TYPE_BUTTON input device
i
pointer to an input device
data
pointer to the data read from the input device Reset input device if a reset query has been sent to it
indev
pointer to an input device

Search the most top, clickable object on the last point of an input device
proc
pointer to the lv_indev_proc_t part of the input device
obj
pointer to a start object, typically the screen
pointer to the found object or NULL if there was no suitable object

Handle the dragging of indev_proc_p->types.pointer.act_obj
indev
pointer to a input device state

Handle throwing by drag if the drag is ended
indev
pointer to an input device state

Checks if the reset_query flag has been set. If so, perform necessary global indev cleanup actions
proc
pointer to an input device 'proc' return true if indev query should be immediately truncated.
Initialize the display input device subsystem

Called periodically to read the input devices
param
pointer to and input device to read

Get the currently processed input device. Can be used in action functions too.
pointer to the currently processed input device or NULL if no input device processing right now

Get the type of an input device
indev
pointer to an input device
the type of the input device from lv_hal_indev_type_t (LV_INDEV_TYPE_...)

Reset one or all input devices
indev
pointer to an input device to reset or NULL to reset all of them

Reset the long press state of an input device
indev
pointer to an input device

Enable or disable an input devices
indev
pointer to an input device
en
true: enable; false: disable

Set a cursor for a pointer input device (for LV_INPUT_TYPE_POINTER and LV_INPUT_TYPE_BUTTON)
indev
pointer to an input device
cur_obj
pointer to an object to be used as cursor

Set a destination group for a keypad input device (for LV_INDEV_TYPE_KEYPAD)
indev
pointer to an input device
group
point to a group

Set the an array of points for LV_INDEV_TYPE_BUTTON. These points will be assigned to the buttons to press a specific point on the screen
indev
pointer to an input device
group
point to a group

Get the last point of an input device (for LV_INDEV_TYPE_POINTER and LV_INDEV_TYPE_BUTTON)
indev
pointer to an input device
point
pointer to a point to store the result

Get the last pressed key of an input device (for LV_INDEV_TYPE_KEYPAD)
indev
pointer to an input device
the last pressed key (0 on error)

Check if there is dragging with an input device or not (for LV_INDEV_TYPE_POINTER and LV_INDEV_TYPE_BUTTON)
indev
pointer to an input device
true: drag is in progress

Get the types.pointer.vector of dragging of an input device (for LV_INDEV_TYPE_POINTER and LV_INDEV_TYPE_BUTTON)
indev
pointer to an input device
point
pointer to a point to store the types.pointer.vector

Do nothing until the next release
indev
pointer to an input device

Get a pointer to the indev read task to modify its parameters with lv_task_... functions.
indev
pointer to an input device
pointer to the indev read refresher task. (NULL on error)

Gets a pointer to the currently active object in the currently processed input device.
pointer to currently active object or NULL if no active object
